column5: After 3 seasons of having a trailer in Honey Harbour and now being on our fourth season, and my brother and his family renting a cottage for a couple weeks a year, we have decided to buy a cottage in Muskoka just north of Bala. Its not on one of the big lakes but the lake is big enough to tube or ski with no problem. As for fishing, there is some largies and some small pike. I'll need to drop the boat into one of the big lakes for some serious fishing. The cottage is a handyman special that has already had the upstairs gutted and partially done, it has a new roof,windows, and siding. The basement is right out of the 70's. Its a four season place and I look forward to watching all the kids grow up at our own little beach.
Congrats , look forward to hearing the stories about your new place
Congrats.  Enjoy your new slice of Heaven
Fantastic  Bruce, that's great news.  Will you have far to trailer the boat for the GB muskies ??
Congrets man!  That's great to hear.
Congrats! Will you be closer to Healey Lake Road, or Twelve Mile for big fish?
Congrats, when's the cottage warming party
congrats, I was on bala for the last 5 days.  Great place

Lew, its about 40 mins or so to HH. The cottage warming party is in 3 weeks when we take posession. It is going to involve multiple loads of garbage a lot of swearing and wondering what we got ourselves into but when done, we will be patting ourselves on the back.

I was fortunate enough to grow up till the age of 21 at georgina beach,10 miles north of wasaga, big house on the lake/bay I should say. If I could only afford to buy a place on the beach. Good times ,great memories. I envy you sir. Loads of memories to come.
Its gonna take a couple of years to git'r done.
Sounds perfect......congrats!!
If you're close to MacTier, you should check out Stewart Lake. Some big, big, REALLY BIG PIKE in there.
Great! See you Labour Day weekend, make sure the beer is cold.
And I want the big bedroom.
That's awesome!!!  Congratulations!!!  The kids will love it...but learn the back roads to get there or try to get midweek off days from work...just sayin
a cottage is on ANY water (big or small) is always good times, congrats on the new adventures and enjoy all projects that always seem to come with them...
PICTURES?!!??!
nice  so I guess it's bigbucks not bigbuck LOL
No pics yet. I'm up in HH on vacation for the next week and a bit and only have my crackberry.
